intro: Psychotria walikalensis subsp. montana, commonly known as the mountain psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. This shrub typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces small, white to purple flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy surface, and it is often found in association with other epiphytic plants in its native habitat.
